description.narrative: Prevention up Front alliance partners produce knowledge about norms and institutions that are relevant for conflict prevention as well as knowledge about capacity building initiatives for civil society. This improves the application of those norms and the operations of those institutions, and increases civil society capacities and effectiveness to respond to armed conflicts.

As part of its communications strategy and awareness-raising efforts, CICC in partnership with its Ivoirian member, publishes quarterly magazines on international justice: role of the Rome Statute in peacebuilding, gender justice and accountability. The main goal for the 2016 publications would be to build support for the Rome Statute in Africa and restore the negative perception that the ICC and international justice have in the continent.
